items.caption: Specify location of the page tab control:

policies.name: L_Pagetabsappearontheleft
policies.displayName: Page tabs appear on the left
policies.explainText: Right: Unchecks the option ''Page tabs appear on the left''. | Left: Checks the option ''Page tabs appear on the left''.

policies.name: L_Verticalscrollbarappearsonleft
policies.displayName: Vertical scroll bar appears on left
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_ShowNoteContainers
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_Navigationbarappearsontheright
policies.displayName: Navigation bar appears on the right
policies.explainText: This option is to specify where the navigation bar appears.

policies.name: L_TurnOffLinkCreationWith
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to turn off link creation with [[ ]].  OneNote allows users to automatically create links by putting [[ ]] around a term.  OneNote will then automatically create a new page in that section and create a link on that text.

If you enable this policy setting, users will not be able to use [[ ]] to create a link and a new page.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, OneNote will automatically create links when users use [[ ]].

policies.name: L_Turnoffautocalculator
policies.explainText: This option turns on/off the auto calculator functionality.

policies.name: L_ShowPasteOptionsbuttons
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_AutoNumberingRecognition
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the option ''Apply numbering to lists automatically''.

policies.name: L_AutoBulletRecognition
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the option ''Apply bullets to lists automatically''.

policies.name: L_DefaultFontName
policies.explainText: Specifies the value in the option ''Font''.

policies.name: L_DefaultFontSize
policies.explainText: Specifies the value in the option ''Size''.

policies.name: L_AutoKeyboardSwitching
policies.explainText: Check/Unchecks the option ''Switch keyboards automatically''.

policies.name: L_IncludelinktosourcewhenpastingfromtheInternet
policies.displayName: Include link to source when pasting from the Internet
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_DisableScratchout
policies.explainText: Disables the scratch out gesture while inking.

policies.name: L_Createallnewpageswithrulelines
policies.displayName: Create all new pages with rule lines
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_Usepenpressuresensitivity
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_AutomaticallyswitchbetweenPenandSelectionTool
policies.displayName: Automatically switch between Pen and Selection Tool
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_ShowTabletPCInputPanelonOneNotepages
policies.displayName: Show Tablet PC Input Panel on OneNote pages
policies.explainText: Enable this policy to display the Tablet PC Input Panel on OneNote pages.

policies.name: L_AttachEmbeddedFilesToTheEmail
policies.displayName: Attach embedded files to the email message as separate files
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to configure the "Attach embedded files to the email message as separate file" option found under File tab | Options | Advanced | E-mail sent from OneNote.

If you enable or do not configure this policy setting, embedded files are attached to the email message as separate files.

If you disable this policy setting, embedded files are not attached to the email message as separate files.

policies.name: L_AllowOneNoteemailattachments
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the option ''Attach a copy of the original notes as a OneNote file''.

policies.name: L_AddsignaturetoOneNoteemailmessages
policies.displayName: Add signature to OneNote email messages
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the option ''Add the following signature to e-mail messages and Web pages created in OneNote''.

items.caption: Enter signature to use for OneNote e-mail

policies.name: L_UsethissignatureforOneNoteemail
policies.displayName: Use this signature for OneNote email
policies.explainText: Sets the value in the option ''Add the following signature to e-mail messages and Web pages created in OneNote''.

policies.name: L_Copyitemswhenmovingthem
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to configure tagged notes.

If you enable or do not configure this policy setting, the option "Leave original tagged notes unchanged" will be checked.

If you disable this policy setting, the option "Show original tagged notes as dimmed" will be checked.

policies.name: L_ShowDimmedTaggedNotesInTheTagsSummaryTaskPane
policies.displayName: Show dimmed tagged notes in the Tags Summary task pane
policies.explainText: Checks/unchecks the option "Show dimmed tagged notes in the Tags Summary task pane."

policies.name: L_Disableaudosearch
policies.explainText: Disables OneNote audio search feature.

policies.name: L_DisableLinkedAudiofeature
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to configure the Record Audio and the Record Video commands on the Insert tab.

If you enable this policy setting, the commands will be not be available.

If you disable or do not configure this policy, the commands will be available.

policies.name: L_Specifynumberofbitstosamplewhenrecording
policies.displayName: Specify number of bits to sample when recording
policies.explainText: Specifies the default number of bits per sample (value is in kbps) used when recording audio. If the appropriate codec is found, then this is the default bit depth used in the Format setting for Linked Audio, found under File tab | Options | Audio & Video.

policies.name: L_Specifyratetosampleaudiobitssecond
policies.explainText: Specifies the default sample rate (value is in kHz) used when recording audio. If the appropriate codec is found, then this is the default sample rate used in the Format setting for Linked Audio found under File tab | Options | Audio & Video.

policies.name: L_Specifynumberofchannelstorecord
policies.displayName: Specify number of channels to record
policies.explainText: Specifies whether 1 or 2 channels are used when recording audio. If the appropriate codec is found, then this is the default number of channels used in the Format setting for Linked Audio found under File tab | Options | Audio & Video.

items.caption: Rewind from start of paragraph by: (sec)

policies.name: L_Rewindfromstartofparagraphbythefollowingnumberofseconds
policies.displayName: Rewind from start of paragraph by the following number of seconds
policies.explainText: Sets the value in the corresponding UI option.

value.string: Windows Media Video 8 for Color Pocket PCs (150 Kbps)
Windows Media Video 8 for Dial-up Modems or Single-channel ISDN (28.8 to 56 Kbps)

item.displayName: Dial-up Modems or Single-channel ISDN (28.8 to 56 Kbps)

value.string: Windows Media Video 8 for LAN, Cable Modem, or xDSL (100 to 768 Kbps)

item.displayName: LAN, Cable Modem, or xDSL (100 to 768 Kbps)

value.string: Windows Media Video 8 for Dial-up Modems or LAN (28.8 to 100 Kbps)

item.displayName: Dial-up Modems or LAN (28.8 to 100 Kbps)

value.string: Windows Media Video 8 for Dial-up Modems (28.8 Kbps)
Windows Media Video 8 for Dial-up Modems (56 Kbps)
Windows Media Video 8 for Local Area Network (100 Kbps)
Windows Media Video 8 for Local Area Network (256 Kbps)
Windows Media Video 8 for Local Area Network (384 Kbps)
Windows Media Video 8 for Broadband (NTSC, 700 Kbps)
Windows Media Video 8 for Broadband (NTSC, 1400 Kbps)
Windows Media Video 8 for Broadband (PAL, 384 Kbps)
Windows Media Video 8 for Broadband (PAL, 700 Kbps)

items.caption: Choose the Windows Media Video 8 codec:

policies.name: L_ChoosedefaultcodectobeusedforVideonotebook
policies.displayName: Choose default codec to be used for Video notebook
policies.explainText: This option will set the default codec used by OneNote for video recording that are created in OneNote.

policies.name: L_SetCNGCipherAlgorithm
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to configure the CNG cipher algorithm that is used.

If you enable this policy setting, then the cipher provided will be used if it is a supported algorithm.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, AES will be used.

value.string: ChainingModeCBC
ChainingModeCFB

policies.name: L_ConfigureCNGCipherChainingMode
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to configure the cipher chaining mode used.

If you enable this policy setting, the cipher chaining mode specified will be applied.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) will be the default CNG cipher chaining mode used.

policies.name: L_SetCNGCipherKeyLength
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to configure the number of bits to use when creating the cipher key.  This number will be rounded down to a multiple of 8.

If you enable this policy setting, the key bits specified will be used.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, the default value will be used.

item.displayName: All files save with next generation format

policies.name: L_SpecifyEncryptionCompatibility
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to specify the encrypted database compatibility.

If you enable this policy setting, the compatibility format specified will be applied during encryption for new files
- Use legacy format
- Use next generation format
- All files save with next generation format

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, the default setting, "Use next generation format," will be applied.

policies.name: L_SetParametersForCNGContext
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to specify the encryption parameters that should be used for the CNG context. 

If you enable this policy setting, the parameters specified will be passed to the CNG context.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, the default CNG values will be used.

value.string: SHA1
SHA256
SHA384
SHA512

policies.name: L_SpecifyCNGHashAlgorithm
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to specify the hash algorithm used.

If you enable this policy setting, the hashing algorithm selected will be used by CNG.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, the default CNG hash algorithm will be used.

policies.name: L_SetCNGPasswordSpinCount
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to specify the number of times to spin (rehash) the password verifier.

If you enable this policy setting, the number specified will be the number of times the password will be rehashed.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, the default (100000) will be used.

policies.name: L_SpecifyCNGRandomNumberGeneratorAlgorithm
policies.displayName: Specify CNG random number generator algorithm
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to configure the CNG random number generator to use.

If you enable this policy setting, the random number generator specified will be used.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, the default random number generator will be used.

policies.name: L_SpecifyCNGSaltLength
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to specific the number of bytes of salt that should be used.

If you enable this policy setting, the bytes specified will be used.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, the default length or 16 will be used.

policies.name: L_NotebookRoot
policies.explainText: To change to where new notebooks are defaulted, enter a path to a folder relative to your documents.

items.caption: Open Side Notes in this section:

policies.name: L_Locationofunfilednotessection
policies.explainText: Location where OneNote stores the unfiled notes section.

policies.name: L_LocationofBackupFolder
policies.explainText: Sets the value in the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_Percentageofunuseddiskspacetoallowinsections
policies.displayName: Percentage of unused disk space to allow in sections
policies.explainText: Sets the value in the option ''Percentage of unused space to allow in sections without optimizing''.

policies.name: L_Disallowsaddonsaccesstopass
policies.displayName: Disallows add-ons access to password protected sections
policies.explainText: This option disallows extensibility add-ons the ability to access password protected sections if they are unlocked.

policies.name: L_Disablepasswordprotectedsections
policies.explainText: Disables the ability to create new password protected sections.  You can however still unlock and edit existing sections which had a password set.

policies.name: L_LockpasswordprotectedsectionsassoonasInavigateawayfromthem
policies.displayName: Lock password protected sections as soon as I navigate away from them
policies.explainText: OneNote supports password protecting sections and they are unlocked once a user types the password and can be locked again by either a timeout period or when you navigate away from the section.  This option will lock the section once you navigate away from the password protected section.

items.caption: Number of backup copies to keep

policies.name: L_Numberofbackupcopiestokeep
policies.displayName: Number of backup copies to keep
policies.explainText: Sets the value in the corresponding UI option.

policies.name: L_DisableOutlooksendemailtoOneNoteoption
policies.displayName: Disable Outlook send email to OneNote option
policies.explainText: This policy disables the OneNote ''Send to OneNote'' add-in for Microsoft Outlook.  By default OneNote installs an add-in on the Outlook toolbar which allows users to send emails to OneNote.  The ''Send to OneNote'' button appears on the main mail module in Outlook as well as when viewing an email message.  You may disable this feature with this policy.

policies.name: L_DisableOneNoteCOMAPI
policies.explainText: Disable OneNote COM API - this disables add-on applications that may use the COM API. Note that it also breaks other features that use this API such as sending information from Outlook to OneNote.

policies.name: L_DisableinstalledOneNoteaddins
policies.explainText: Turns off all of the installed OneNote Add-ins.

policies.name: L_OneNoteSpellingOptions
policies.explainText: These options change the "When correcting spelling in OneNote" options that appear in the File tab | Option | Proofing dialog box.

policies.name: L_TurnOffVersionsAndNotebookRecycleBinInSharedNotebooks
policies.displayName: Turn off Versions and Notebook Recycle Bin in shared notebooks
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to turn off version history which includes versions and the notebook recycle bin.  With a 2016 format notebook, OneNote will automatically store previous versions of the pages in the notebook, and it will also store a recycle bin for all of the deleted pages and sections.

If you enable this policy setting, it will turn off version history.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, OneNote will store previous versions by default.

policies.name: L_DoNotPruneVersionsOverTime
policies.displayName: Do not prune versions over time
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to turn off OneNote's automatic pruning.  With a 2016 format notebook, OneNote will automatically store previous versions of the pages in the notebook, and it will also store a recycle bin for all of the deleted pages and sections.

If you enable this policy setting, OneNote will not prune previous versions.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, OneNote will prune previous versions.  The default value is to prune versions over time.  You should only enable this policy setting if OneNote should not prune previous versions.

policies.name: L_DaysOfAllVersions
policies.displayName: Days all Version History items are "safe" from pruning
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to specify a period of time during which OneNote maintains comprehensive version history pages. After the time specified, OneNote maintains more basic version history pages, which uses less storage space.

If you enable this policy setting, OneNote maintains comprehensive version history pages for the length of time you specify, and then maintains basic version history pages once the time period expires.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, OneNote maintains comprehensive version history pages for 2 days, and then maintains basic version history pages once the time period expires.

policies.name: L_DaysOfHourlyVersionsNotToPruneAfterDaysBack
policies.displayName: Days of hourly versions not to prune after Days Back
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to set the number of hourly versions not to prune after Days Back.  With a 2016 format notebook, OneNote will automatically store previous versions of the pages in the notebook, and it will also store a recycle bin for all of the deleted pages and sections.

If you enable this policy setting, you may specify the number of days to keep hourly versions after the Days Back setting. This value specifies the number of days past "DaysOfAllVersions" to keep hourly version history information.  Users will keep one version per hour for this number of days after "DaysOfAllVersions".

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, OneNote will keep hourly versions for the past 5 days.

policies.name: L_MaximumNumberOfOncePerDayVersionHistoryItemsKept
policies.displayName: Maximum number of once-per-day version history items kept
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to set the number of once-per-day history items to be kept for each page.  With a 2016 format notebook, OneNote will automatically store previous versions of the pages in the notebook, and it will also store a recycle bin for all of the deleted pages and sections.

If you enable this policy setting, you can set the number of versions per day to keep.  If you set a value of -1 this will tell OneNote to keep all old once-per-day version history items.
 
If you disable or do not configure this policy setting OneNote will keep a page for the past 10 days every day in the past.

policies.name: L_DaysBackToKeepInVersionHistory
policies.displayName: Days back to keep in version history
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to set the number of days when all version history items created before this value will be deleted.  With a 2016 format notebook, OneNote will automatically store previous versions of the pages in the notebook, and it will also store a recycle bin for all of the deleted pages and sections.

If you enable this policy setting, you can set the number of days back to delete version history.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting OneNote will default to keeping previous versions for all days in the past.  This is the default value of -1.

items.caption: Days back to keep items in recycle bin

policies.name: L_DaysBackToKeepItemsInRecycleBin
policies.displayName: Days back to keep items in recycle bin
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to set the number of days before which all items added to the Recycle Bin before value will be deleted when the version history is pruned.  With a 2016 format notebook, OneNote will automatically store previous versions of the pages in the notebook, and it will also store a recycle bin for all of the deleted pages and sections.

If you enable this policy setting, you can set the number of days in the past to keep recycle bin items.

If you do not configure this policy setting OneNote will use the default value of 60 days in the past.

policies.name: L_SetUNCIntervalToPollForChangesOnFileServers
policies.displayName: Set UNC interval to poll for changes on file servers
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to change the synchronization interval at which OneNote will poll for changes on the server.  When OneNote synchronizes a notebook on UNC, also known as SMB or Windows File shares, OneNote will receive notifications from the file server as well as poll the server looking for new updates on the server.

By making the interval faster it will make OneNote synchronize faster, but it also might cause performance issues on the server.

If you enable this policy setting, you may specify the number of seconds OneNote will poll.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, OneNote will automatically poll every 30 seconds.

policies.name: L_TurnOffOneNoteAutoLinkedNoteTaking
policies.displayName: Turn off OneNote auto-linked note taking
policies.explainText:
This policy setting turns off the OneNote auto note taking feature which allows you to take notes on items such as webpages, Word documents, etc.  OneNote will automatically record what pages or document you were viewing when you took this note.

If you enable this policy setting, OneNote will not automatically link notes when the user tries to turn on this feature.

If you disable or do not enable this policy, OneNote will automatically link notes when the user tries to turn on this feature.

policies.name: L_DisableOCR
policies.explainText: This policy turns off the OneNote image optical character recognition (OCR) feature. The OCR feature allows OneNote to automatically scan through images to find text that will appear in search results.

policies.name: L_EmbeddedFilesBlockedExtensions
policies.explainText: To disable the ability of the users in your organization from being able to open a file attachment of a specific file type from a Microsoft OneNote page, add the extensions you want to disable using this format: ".ext1;.ext2;" If you want to disable the opening of any attachment from a OneNote page, see the Disable embedded files policy. You cannot block embedded audio and video recordings (WMA & WMV) with this policy instead refer to the Disable embedded files policy.

policies.name: L_Loadanotebookonfirstboot
policies.displayName: Load a notebook on first boot
policies.explainText: Points to a folder containing a notebook that should be loaded on first boot.

policies.name: L_Disableembeddedfiles
policies.explainText: To disable the ability to embed files on a OneNote page, so people cannot transmit files that might not be caught by anti-virus software, etc.  Note: This policy will only limit embedded files in the OneNote UI, if a page has an embedded file OneNote will still sync and replicate the embedded files in the file system.

policies.name: L_DisableOneNotescreenclippingnotifications
policies.explainText: Turns off all of the OneNote screen clipping notifications.

policies.name: L_DisableOneNoteScreenClippings
policies.explainText: Disables the screen clipping feature in OneNote.

policies.name: L_Numberofdaysbeforewarningthatserveris
policies.displayName: Number of days before warning that server is inaccessible
policies.explainText: Set the number of days until OneNote warns that the server is inaccessible and prompts for a new location for the affected files.

policies.name: L_SharePointsyncinterval
policies.displayName: SharePoint sync interval for notebooks stored on SharePoint
policies.explainText: Limits the number of times OneNote polls a SharePoint site for changes to a section.  Enter the sync interval in seconds.

policies.name: L_SharePointbackgroundsyncintervalmultiplier
policies.displayName: Multiplier for background sync interval for notebooks stored on SharePoint
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to increase the interval between background polls of a SharePoint site for changes to notebooks.

If you enable this policy setting, OneNote will poll SharePoint less frequently for changes to whole notebooks. Intervals are multiplied by the entered value, a positive integer value from 1 to 10. Larger intervals will slow notebook sync but reduce server load.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, OneNote will sync notebooks at the default rate (multiplier value of 1).

Note: This policy setting only applies to volume licensed versions of Office 2016 that use Windows Installer (MSI), such as Office Professional Plus 2016 and Office Standard 2016.

policies.name: L_SharePointlivesyncintervalmultiplier
policies.displayName: Multiplier for foreground sync interval for the currently viewed section stored on SharePoint
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to increase the interval between foreground polls of a SharePoint site for changes to the currently viewed section.

If you enable this policy setting, OneNote will poll SharePoint less frequently for changes to the currently viewed section. Intervals are multiplied by the entered value, a positive integer value from 1 to 10. Larger intervals will slow section sync but reduce server load.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, OneNote will sync the currently viewed section at the default rate (multiplier value of 1).

Note: This policy setting only applies to volume licensed versions of Office 2016 that use Windows Installer (MSI), such as Office Professional Plus 2016 and Office Standard 2016.

policies.name: L_SharePointpresenceintervalmultiplier
policies.displayName: Multiplier for Presence sync interval for notebooks stored on SharePoint
policies.explainText:
This policy setting allows you to increase the interval between polls to SharePoint to determine active users of notebooks. OneNote will sync notebooks at a faster rate when other users are interacting with a notebook.

If you enable this policy setting, OneNote will poll SharePoint less frequently to determine if there are other users currently interacting with notebooks. Intervals are multiplied by the entered value, a positive integer value from 1 to 10. Larger intervals will slow detection of concurrent users in notebooks but reduce server load.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, OneNote will poll for active users of notebooks at the default rate (multiplier value of 1).

Note: This policy setting only applies to volume licensed versions of Office 2016 that use Windows Installer (MSI), such as Office Professional Plus 2016 and Office Standard 2016.

policies.name: L_DefaultunitofmeasurementusedinOneNote
policies.displayName: Default unit of measurement used in OneNote
policies.explainText: Sets the value in the option ''Measurement units''.

policies.name: L_AddOneNoteicontonotificationarea
policies.displayName: Add OneNote icon to notification area
policies.explainText: Checks/Unchecks the option ''Place OneNote icon in the notification area of the taskbar''.

policies.name: L_NotebookPresence
policies.explainText:
This policy setting enables or disables the Notebook Presence feature in OneNote, which broadcasts user presence within a notebook and enables real-time synchronization for users who are editing the same page. Note:  Any change to this policy does not take effect until OneNote is restarted.

If you enable or do not configure this policy setting, users are notified when they are editing the same page in a notebook as another user. OneNote also enters real-time sync when it discovers multiple users editing the same page. 

If you disable this policy setting, users are not notified when they are editing the same page in a notebook as another user. OneNote does not enter real-time sync when multiple users are editing the same page.

policies.name: L_SpecifyEmbeddedFileSizeLimit
policies.explainText:
This policy setting enables you to specify the maximum embedded file size that users can insert directly into a OneNote notebook on a SharePoint server.
 
If you enable this policy setting, you can increase or decrease the default maximum file size of 50 MB. 

If you increase this value, users can insert larger files directly into the notebook, but this may reduce server performance. 

If you decrease this value, users can only insert smaller files directly into the notebook, which may improve server performance if OneNote sync is generating a lot of traffic.

If you disable or do not configure this policy setting, users cannot insert a file larger than 50MB inserted into a OneNote notebook. Instead, the file is uploaded to a SharePoint folder and inserted as a hyperlink into the notebook.

value.string: true
true
true
false
false
false

policies.name: L_onenoteVisualRefresh
policies.explainText:
Enable or disable visual refresh. may not work for some versions of Office.

Data provided by Office Tool Plus.
